The presence of two methyl groups can lower the melting point due to increased molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated to be around -5 degrees Celsius each. The benzodioxine ring can also contribute to the melting point due to its planarity and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
